sub_topic: Determining the volume of a sphere.
message_1: What is the volume of a sphere with a radius of 10 cm? (Round your answer to two decimal places.)
message_2:
The volume of a sphere is given by the formula V = (4/3)πr³, where V is the volume and r is the radius.

Given a radius of 10 cm, we can calculate the volume as follows:

V = (4/3)π(10)³
V = (4/3)π(1000)
V = 4,188.79 cm³ (rounded to two decimal places)
